## Antipatrid dynasty

Other Diadochi
Other
|333x333px
The Antipatrid dynasty (; ) was a Dorian Greek dynasty of the ancient Greek kingdom of Macedon founded by Cassander, the son of Antipater, who declared himself King of Macedon in 305 BC. This dynasty did not last long; in 294 BC it was swiftly overthrown by the Antigonid dynasty.
Members of the Antipatrid dynasty:
*Antipater, regent, not king
*Cassander (305–297 BC)
*Philip IV of Macedon (297 BC)
*Alexander V of Macedon (297–294 BC)
*Antipater I (296–294 BC)
*Antipater II Etesias (279 BC)
Family tree of Antipatrids
See also
* History of Macedonia (ancient kingdom)
* Government of Macedonia (ancient kingdom)
